newsitem.title: USA: Georgia adds 11,100 jobs in April - labor chief.
newsitem.headline: Georgia adds 11,100 jobs in April - labor chief.

text.p: Georgia added 11,100 new jobs in April, putting total non-farm employment at 3.57 million, state Labor Commissioner David Poythress said.

A lot of the gains were in sectors involved in outdoor work, including construction, landscaping, horticulture and agriculture services, amusements, recreation and tourism-related operations, Poythress said.
Atlanta had the biggest gains, adding 8,800 new jobs in April to put its employment at 1.94 million.
Other metropolitan areas and their changes for April were:
Over the year, Georgia has added 70,400 jobs, an increase of two percent.
